snippet: Hu Jintao is unlikely to ever face a Spanish court for a Tibetan exile group’s complaints of human rights abuses, but the move angered China anyway.
abstract: Spain’s national court approves indictment of former Chinese Pres Hu Jintao as part of investigation into whether the Chinese government tortured and repressed the people of Tibet as part of an attempted genocide.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: Hu Jintao is unlikely to ever face a Spanish court for a Tibetan exile group’s complaints of human rights abuses, but the move angered China anyway.

headline.main: Spain to Proceed With Indictment of China’s Ex-President
headline.print_headline:
Spain: China’s Policies in Tibet
Draw Attention in a Legal Case

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
